Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CATHPb1 (Lys-rich; natural AMPs; cathelicidins; snake, reptiles, animals; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 60% similarity toCrotalicidin. molecular formula: C187H308N50O34; Mol Wt: 3800.784; GRAVY = -0.4.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC25923 or MRSA (MIC 4.6-37 ug/mL), S. epidermidis (MIC 18.75 ug/mL), N. asteroids (MIC 9.38 ug/ml), B. cereus (MIC 1.17 ug/ml), E. faecalis IS 981 (MIC 75 ug/mL), E. faecium IS 1299 (MIC 9.38 ug/mL), Gram- E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 9.38 ug/ml), K. oxytoca (MIC 75 ug/ml) , S. paratyphi IS 738 (MIC 18.75 ug/ml), D. bacillus (MIC 1.17 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 18.75 ug/ml), S. maltophilia (MIC 4.69 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 9.38-37.5 ug/ml), and fungi C. albicans (MIC 9.38-18.75 ug/mL) and C. glabrata (MIC 9.38-18.75 ug/ml).  It also shows antibiofilm activity and anti-inflammatory activity. This peptide also showed good activity against aquatic bacteria Gram- V. alginolyticus, V. anguillarum, V. brasiliensis, V. cholerae, V. fluvialis, V. harveyi (MIC all 2.47 uM),  V. parahaemolyticus (MIC 0.62 uM),  V. splendidus (MIC 2.47 uM),  V. vulnificus. (MIC 4.93 uM), A. hydrophila (MIC 1.23 uM), A. sobria (MIC 2.29 uM),  A.veronii (MIC 4.93 uM), and N. asteroides (MIC 4.93) (Ouyang et al., 2022).Structure:  The peptide is helical in the presence of SDS or TFE.Toxicity:  hRBC: 6.63% at 100 ug/ml. At 200 uM, it caused 15.5% and 27.8% deaath of fish cells EPC and FHM, respectively. Updated 3/2018; 7/2021; 5/2023
Literature Information.Author: Cai S, Qiao X, Feng L, Shi N, Wang H, Yang H, Guo Z, Wang M, Chen Y, Wang Y, Yu H.2018
Literature Information.Title: Python Cathelicidin CATHPb1 Protects against Multidrug-Resistant Staphylococcal Infections by Antimicrobial-Immunomodulatory Duality.
